Q: Which SQL statement is used to retrieve data from a database?
Which SQL statement is used to insert new data into a database?
Which SQL statement is used to update existing data in a database?
Which SQL statement is used to delete data from a database?
What is a primary key in SQL?

O.a: A column that uniquely identifies each row in a table
O.b: A column that contains unique values, but can be NULL
O.c: A column that is indexed for faster searching
O.d: A column that is used to link two tables

Q: What is a foreign key in SQL?

O.a: A column that uniquely identifies each row in a table
O.b: A column that contains unique values, but can be NULL
O.c: A column that is indexed for faster searching
O.d: A column that is used to link two tables

O.b: A description of the structure of a database
O.c: A single table in a database

Q: What is a join in SQL?

O.a: A way to combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column
O.b: A way to filter data in a table
O.c: A way to sort data in a table
O.d: A way to create a new table

Q: What does the WHERE clause do in SQL?

O.b: Specifies the order to sort data
O.d: Specifies the table to select from

Q: What does the ORDER BY clause do in SQL?

O.b: Specifies the order to sort data
O.d: Specifies the table to select from

Q: What does the GROUP BY clause do in SQL?

O.a: Groups rows that have the same values in specified columns
O.b: Sorts rows in a specified order
O.c: Filters rows based on specified criteria

Q: What does the HAVING clause do in SQL?

O.a: Filters groups of rows after grouping
O.b: Sorts rows in ascending or descending order

Q: What is an index in SQL?

O.a: A data structure that improves the speed of data retrieval operations on a database table
O.b: A way to uniquely identify each row in a table
O.c: A way to link two tables together
O.d: A way to create a new table
